Package com.gamerbah.inventorytoolkit

Class GameInventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gamerbah.inventorytoolkit.GameInventory

  • public class GameInventory
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      GameInventory​(java.lang.String name, int size)
      Creates a new GameInventoryProto object sans a previous Inventory and preset items

      Creates a new GameInventoryProto object sans a previous Inventory
      GameInventory​(java.lang.String name, int itemCount, int size, GameInventory previousInventory)
      Creates a new GameInventoryProto object
      GameInventory​(java.lang.String name, int size, GameInventory previousInventory)
      Creates a new GameInventoryProto object sans preset items
      GameInventory​(java.lang.String name, GameInventory previousInventory)
      Creates a new GameInventoryProto object of size 54 sans preset items

                     int itemCount,
                     int size,
                     GameInventory previousInventory)
        Creates a new GameInventoryProto object
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the Inventory
        itemCount - the amount of preset items in the Inventory
        size - the size of the Inventory
        previousInventory - the GameInventoryProto to go back to when a "Back" button is clicked

    • Method Detail

      • addItem

        protected void addItem​(ItemBuilder itemBuilder)
        Adds a new sortable item

        NOTE: Items are not physically added to the Inventory until it's opened

        Parameters:
        itemBuilder - the ItemBuilder to add
        See Also:
        ItemBuilder, InventoryBuilder

      • getItems

        public java.util.ArrayList<ItemBuilder> getItems​()
        Gets the list of sortable items
        Returns:
        the list of items

      • addButton

        protected void addButton​(int slot,
                         ItemBuilder itemBuilder)
        Adds a static, unsortable item that is added to the Inventory once build() is called
        Parameters:
        slot - the Inventory slot this item will be held in
        itemBuilder - the ItemBuilder to add
        See Also:
        ItemBuilder, InventoryBuilder

      • getButtons

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,ItemBuilder> getButtons​()
        Gets the list of static buttons
        Returns:
        the list of buttons, deep copied

      • openPreviousInventory

        protected void openPreviousInventory​(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Opens the previous GameInventory specified in this class

        If no previous GameInventory is set, the player's Inventory is closed

        Parameters:
        player - the Player to open the previous GameInventoryProto for

      • setItemCount

        protected void setItemCount​(int amount)
        Manually sets the item count if that constructor was not used
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount of items

      • setSearchRows

        protected void setSearchRows​(int startRow,
                             int stopRow)
        Sets the amount of search rows for inventories that should act as "data libraries"

        Not applicable for inventories that aren't meant for searching (i.e selection-type menus)
        (Slots 1-9 are row 1, 10-18: 2, etc.)

        Parameters:
        startRow - the Inventory row to start the search box at
        stopRow - the Inventory row to stop the search box at
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the rows are > max rows of the Inventory, and if startRow is > stopRow

      • getSearchRows

        public int getSearchRows​()
        Gets the amount of rows in the search box
        Returns:
        the amount of rows

      • setSearchOffset

        protected void setSearchOffset​(int top,
                               int bottom)
        Sets a search box offset

        Each offset will create an blank slot starting on the outside going in
        i.e if the top offset is 2 and the bottom offset is 3 in a search box for rows 1 & 2, the search items will begin at slot 3 and end at slot 15

        Parameters:
        top - the amount of slots to keep empty at the front of the search box
        bottom - the amount of slots to keep empty at the bottom of the search box

      • setSearchOffset

        protected void setSearchOffset​(int offset)
        Sets a search box offset that is bi-directionally equidistant

        Calls setSearchOffset(int top, int bottom) keeping both values the same

        Parameters:
        offset - the offset to apply to each end of the search box

      • addBorder

        protected void addBorder​(int row,
                         org.bukkit.DyeColor color)
        Adds a row of immovable colored stained glass to act as a border

        This is mainly between a search box and search sorting items

        Parameters:
        row - the Inventory row to place the border at
        color - the DyeColor that the stained glass should be
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the row is > max rows of the Inventory, or if there is already a border at that row

      • addBorder

        protected void addBorder​(int row)
        Adds a row of immovable black stained glass to act as a border

        Makes a call to addBorder(int row, DyeColor color)

        Parameters:
        row - the Inventory row to place the border at

      • removeBorder

        protected void removeBorder​(int row)
        Removes a border
        Parameters:
        row - the Inventory row to place the border at
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the row is > max rows of the Inventory, or if there isn't a border at that row

      • removeBorders

        protected void removeBorders​()
        Removes all borders, if any are set

      • setBackButton

        protected void setBackButton​(boolean backButton)
        Sets whether page navigation buttons are placed in offset slots This will add 1 to the offsets
        Parameters:
        backButton - sets if a "Back" button will be visible on page 1
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if there are no search rows

      • setInlineNavigation

        protected void setInlineNavigation​(boolean inline)
        Sets whether page navigation buttons are placed inline

        This adds 1 to the current offsets

        Parameters:
        inline - forces page navigation buttons to be placed in-line with search boxes
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if there are no search rows

      • setAllowCreative

        protected void setAllowCreative​(boolean allowCreative)
        Sets whether this inventory is able to be clicked while in creative mode
        Parameters:
        allowCreative - whether to allow creative clicks

      • setPageRow

        protected void setPageRow​(int row)
        Sets which row page navigation buttons will appear on
        Parameters:
        row - the inventory row (0-based) to put the buttons on
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if there are no search rows, or if inlineNav == true
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if row is > the max rows in the inventory

      • build

        public InventoryBuilder build​(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Builds a new InventoryBuilder object from the current GameInventory
        Parameters:
        player - the Player to build this Inventory for
        Returns:
        a new InventoryBuilder instance of this GameInventoryProto
